name: useClickAway
description: Custom hook that triggers a callback when a user clicks outside the referenced element. It handles portal elements, scrollbar clicks, and touch interactions intelligently.

props.name: onClickAway
props.description: The callback function to be called when a click outside is detected.

schema.name: disableReactTree
schema.description: If `true`, the React tree is ignored and only the DOM tree is considered. This prop changes how portaled elements are handled.

schema.name: mouseEvent
schema.description: The mouse event to listen to. You can disable the listener by providing `false`.

schema.name: ref
schema.description: An external ref to merge with the hook's internal ref. Useful if you need to access the DOM element outside of this hook.

schema.name: touchEvent
schema.description: The touch event to listen to. You can disable the listener by providing `false`.
